org.gatein.api.common.i18n
Class LocalizedString

java.lang.Object
  org.gatein.api.common.i18n.Localized<String>
      org.gatein.api.common.i18n.LocalizedString
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Iterable<String>
public class LocalizedString
extends Localized<String>

A LocalizedString can represent a single value (non localized) or many values each mapping to a specific Locale

Author:
Nick Scavelli
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

LocalizedString

public LocalizedString(LocalizedString localizedString)

LocalizedString

public LocalizedString(String value)
Constructor to create a non localized string. The result will include a Value with a null Locale.

Parameters:
value - the value to represent the non localized string

LocalizedString

public LocalizedString(Locale locale,
                       String value)
Constructor to create a localized string.

Parameters:
locale - the locale of the value
value - the value

LocalizedString

public LocalizedString(Map<Locale,String> valueMap)
Constructor to create a localized string with multiple values.

Parameters:
valueMap - the map containing the Locale->String mapping.
Method Detail

getValue

public String getValue()
This method returns the value for a non localized string. If the string is localized this will return null. This is equivalent to calling Localized.getValue(java.util.Locale) and passing in null for the Locale

Returns:
the value or null if the string is localized.

setValue

public LocalizedString setValue(String value)
This will clear any localized values, and convert the string to a non localized string.

Parameters:
value - the value
Returns:
the localized string

setLocalizedValue

public LocalizedString setLocalizedValue(Locale locale,
                                         String value)
This method will first remove the non localized value if one exists then sets the value for the specified locale. If a locale already exists this will override the previous value mapped to that locale.

Overrides:
setLocalizedValue in class Localized<String>
Parameters:
locale - the locale
value - the value
Returns:
the localized string

isLocalized

public boolean isLocalized()
Indicates if the string is localized or not.

Returns:
true if the string is localized, false otherwise.
